intro: Amblyanthera acutiloba, commonly known as the sharp-lobed amblyanthera, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions with high humidity and well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of botanical circles.
